specialities: (UI) User Interface Design,(UX) User Experience Design
responsibilities:
Lead UX research and user studies activities.

Oversee the UI/UX team.

Support high-level game design in intuitive UX flows. Brainstorm ideas and create prototypes to help find creative solutions.

Create and express design decisions with a data-informed vision, design rationale and solutions to team members: designers, artists, engineers, producers.

Preparing wireframes and prototypes with a variety of design and prototyping tools (such as Figma, Adobe XD, Sketch, etc).

Create UI screens/art elements and implement in Unity
benefits:
Competitive salary + bonus.

Generous relocation budget and assistance.

Rent budget provided for a year.

Tuition for children to attend international school.

1 x ticker per person every year to travel back home.

2500 USD per year for gym or leisure.

VIP health insurance.

1 x month hotel expenses covered (while apartment-hunting)

responsibilities:
Be the primary link between the studio’s graphics team and work along with the Producer and Creative Director to establish a clear artistic vision for the game.

Create diverse, innovative, and functional art styles for the game.

Define the visual identity of the game, pitches, and style guides.

Set up the best practices and standards for production based on industry benchmarks and share your expertise with the team members.

Review and validate the assets which adhere to the product vision. 

​​Establish Art production pipeline & recommend which process to pursue to ensure the right level of quality.

Oversee the whole game’s graphic quality and art content production in collaboration with the art team.

Led multiple art disciplines, including UI/UX and Marketing asset creation.

Oversee the recruitment and handle the training of the art department, including concept art, 3D modeling, FX, and lighting.

Data-oriented mindset, strong sense, and experience with Product KPIs.

Manage the communication with the shareholders about artistic & art technical matters.

Advocate game-developer mindset in the team beyond mastery of artistic and technical subjects.

responsibilities:
Creation of highpoly and lowpoly models of plants and crops
Creation of UV maps and textures for PBR
Setting up materials for a proprietary game engine
requirements:
At least 3 years in the game industry (at least one shipped title)
Very good knowledge of Autodesk Maya
Ability to create realistic 3D models of plants and textures in AAA quality
Rich experience with foliage creation
Experience with PBR workflow
Attention to detail and precision
Good knowledge of English language
Excellent ability to work in a team
idealAdditions:
Art oriented education (3d art, design, art school)
Experience with Substance Designer / Painter or 3D Coat
Experience with preparation of models for shader animation
Previous experience with production of assets for real-time simulators
aboutStudio: Creators of the globally acclaimed Simulation series. But, we’re not just developers. We’re a publisher. We’re engine creators.
theirCulture: Working together - world-wide, and no matter the department or position. Instead of managing ourselves into dead ends, our passionate employees look for collaborative ways to grow themselves - individually, as a team, as a company. That’s why you find enthusiastic and open-minded people in every department and every single office, happy to work with you.
reasonsToWork:
Variety: A challenging job and exciting projects with plenty of room for creativity and innovative ideas
Work-life balance: Flexible working hours
Great working atmosphere: Flat hierarchies and everyone at eye level
Personal development: Individual opportunities for professional advancement, tailored to your needs and wishes
benefits:
Modern workplace: Office in a top location with good public transport connections
Extras: Drinks, snacks and fruit are of course free in our company

responsibilities:
Supporting designers and product managers in their day-to-day needs: finding insights from data through quantitative and qualitative analysis, ideating, and monitoring the impact of our design decisions

Proactively analyzing our game data to spot opportunities for improvements and growth that will guide our game design and monetisation strategies

Designing and evaluating experiments

Driving decision making through in-depth statistical modeling and analyses, and well crafted presentations for both technical and non-technical team members

Spreading best practices to elevate our data team’s success

Building and maintaining dashboards, version-controlled tools and reports

Designing analytics tracking events that help us better understand our players and features

Designing data pipelines in cooperation with our data engineering team, when needed
requirements:
Proficiency in SQL and coding skills in a scripting language like Python or R

Hands-on experience in data modeling and cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, BigQuery or Redshift

Practical knowhow of some BI tool such as Looker, Qlick, Tableau or similar

Solid knowledge of industry standard statistical analyses like A/B testing

Proactive drive and vision to work on what’s important and impactful

Curious personality with good teamwork skills
idealAdditions:
Passion for gaming

Work history in the F2P gaming industry

Extensive experience in applying data science methods from concept to production

Practical knowledge in metrics/semantic-layer and or dbt

Degree in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or Engineering
aboutStudio: We are a Helsinki-based games company that crafts chart-topping mobile experiences and is one of the fastest growing game companies in Europe. Launched in 2020, our first global hit game already has almost 50 million players.
theirCulture:
We focus on what matters most
We always consider all viable options and ideas, and then go all-in and stick with the best one. This means saying no to all other options – at least for the moment. Because only by radically prioritising our work can we pursue the most impactful actions.

We make informed decisions with freedom and responsibility
We work autonomously, which means that our teams and individuals have the freedom to make decisions over the things they’re responsible for. We ask and give feedback proactively to inform our decisions – not least because that builds trust and helps us respect each other’s autonomy and decision-making power.
reasonsToWork: Our everyday actions, the work we do and the decisions we make. It’s based on uncompromised trust and guided by our whole team’s mutual agreement on how we want to work together.
benefits:
Relocating to Finland expected, full support provided
Hybrid model of office and remote work

responsibilities:
Diving hands-on into all areas of our game development, including graphic programming, game logic, and UI

Supporting and contributing to game design with fresh ideas

Writing logically clear, high-quality and robust code

Wrenching out simple solutions to complex problems

Taking initiative and working independently as well as in collaboration with other teams
requirements:
Great deal of knowledge on various game technology areas (gameplay, graphics, tools etc.) and the understanding that there’s always more to learn

Strong, professional background using Unity through previous projects

Knowing C# like the back of your hand

Ability to swiftly digest existing code, and feel comfortable using it

Hands-on experience working with a live game

Excellent English you’ll use to express yourself comfortably in meetings and on paper
idealAdditions:
Ambition and excitement to build world-class games
More passion and skills for a certain role than anyone in our team
Market-oriented approach to measuring success
Motivation to build games for our players, not for yourself
aboutStudio: We are a Helsinki-based games company that crafts chart-topping mobile experiences and is one of the fastest growing game companies in Europe. Launched in 2020, our first global hit game already has almost 50 million players.
theirCulture:
1. We always put the studio first
Putting the studio first means putting our people first. We make decisions that are best for our whole team in the long run. Our success is ultimately up to our team’s well-being and performance. After all, and regardless of how popular our games or solid our business KPIs are, the studio is just a passionate team of ambitious professionals who enjoy working together.

2. We have a high ambition level & passion for our roles
We set our bar so high, that by the time we’re happy with our own work, we know it’s world-class. That goes for all roles and responsibilities: although we’re passionate about different things and work in different roles, we share the same, extremely high ambition level.

3. We show ownership and carry our responsibility
We all have ownership of the studio and proactively work for the common good of our whole team. We are highly committed professionals who take initiative and show ownership – even beyond our primary responsibilities, if that’s for the best. We’re all in this together, and we let it show.
reasonsToWork: Our teams and individuals enjoy a lot of freedom and responsibility in their work. Everyone can find the optimal way for reaching their goals – as long as it respects our company culture.
benefits:
Relocating to Finland expected, full support provided
Hybrid model of office and remote work

responsibilities:
Drive Development - Drive the continuous development and optimization of our flagship game: Forge of Empires

Enhance Fun - Develop innovative features and refine existing game elements with a strong focus on UI and UX

Collaborate with the Team - Work closely with Mobile & Backend Developers, Game Designers, and Artists to deliver new game features

Own the Game - Involve yourself in the entire feature development lifecycle, striving for high-quality outputs
requirements:
Professional experience - Demonstrated expertise in Frontend Development, ideally with Haxe / JavaScript

Passionate creator - Exceptional attention to detail and a love for crafting captivating UI and UX

Software craftsmanship - Well-versed in design patterns and clean code
idealAdditions:
Solution-oriented - An efficient, proactive approach to problem-solving

Global team player - Comfortable using English daily and working in a multicultural, international environment
aboutStudio: InnoGames is one of the leading German developers of mobile and browser games and a certified Great Place to Work®. The climate-neutral company based in Hamburg was founded in 2007 and is now part of the Modern Times Group (MTG). Together with 350+ employees from over 40 nations, the company founders develop unique games that provide years of fun for millions of players around the world. InnoGames is best known for Forge of Empires, Elvenar and Tribal Wars, but the company is continually expanding its now 10-game portfolio across platforms and genres. The most recent additions were Rise of Cultures and Sunrise Village, which were launched in early 2022.
theirCulture:
Team of specialists - Shape the success story of InnoGames and be a part of our international team of professionals in a stable growing company and award-winning employer.

English first - Our company language is English, and we support all our employees and their partners with optional German lessons
reasonsToWork:
Hybrid Working Model - We offer our colleagues the flexibility to choose between working from home and our modern offices in central Hamburg. With regular times planned together at the office during our Office Days, we keep up our unique InnoGames spirit!

Flexible working hours - We offer trust-based working hours as well as active breaks - play table tennis with your team, work out in our gym or go to our rooftop terrace to get some fresh air.

Compensation & Fair Play - We have career models as well as market-competitive salary grids in place that ensure that we treat our employees fairly. For this regular-level position, the salary range is between € 58.000-75.000 gross p.a. Your seniority level (junior, regular, senior) will be evaluated during the interview process. The salary ranges for other seniority levels differ.

Outstanding benefits - Get 28 vacation days, a sabbatical, mobile device, contribution to your public transport ticket, and more.

Relocation assistance - f you are interested in relocating to Hamburg, we will help you relocate to Hamburg regarding all the needed resources.

Comfy and modern offices - Learn more about our charms and benefits in our virtual office tour.
